ilog.opl

Class IloOplFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ilog.opl.IloOplFactory

  • public class IloOplFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The OPL factory allows you to create instances of OPL objects like models, datasources, etc. It initializes the OPL environment. The method end() allows you to clean the memory used by all objects allocated by this factory. Be sure to use it when OPL is no longer used.
    You can also manage memory more finely by calling end() on individual objects earlier, as soon as you don't need them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IloOplFactory()
      Initialize the OPL environement necessary to create other objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getOplFactoryFrom

        public static IloOplFactory getOplFactoryFrom(IloOplModel oplModel)
        Gets an OPL factory from an existing OPL model. This allows you to obtain a factory (suitable to create other objects) from a model, whether it was created itself by an IloOplFactory or by Java code (case if you obtain it from Java, while calling external Java code from script).

      • setDebugMode

        public static void setDebugMode(boolean debug)
        Sets debug mode on/off. When debug mode is on, additionnal checks are carried out in methods, resulting in exceptions thrown to help you diagnose problems.
        It is always a good thing to have debug mode on when developping your application. In particular, you may want to have it on if you experiment a core dump when running Java code.
        Notice that debug mode introduces a slowdown, so make sure it is set to "off" when you release your application.
        The default mode is "on", and this print a warning message on the console (which can be disabled, see setDebugModeWarning(boolean)

      • setDebugModeWarning

        public static void setDebugModeWarning(boolean warning)
        Sets the debug-mode warning message on/off. You can call this method to disable the warning message while you are still using debug mode.

      • registerLicense

        public static void registerLicense(java.lang.String license,
                   int signature)
                            throws IloException

        Entry point for runtime licenses.

        Throws an IloException in case of failure.

        This method is deprecated in IBM ILOG CPLEX Optimization Studio V12.3. You need to register licenses for the ILOG CPLEX and ILOG CP Optimizer engines separately, using the methods IloCplex.registerLicense or IloCP.registerLicense.
        Throws:
        IloException
        Parameters:
        license - a string containing the RUNTIME key.
        signature - an integer associated with the RUNTIME key, obtained with the key.

      • releaseLicense

        public static void releaseLicense()
        Forces OPL to release the license it is currently holding. This method is deprecated in IBM ILOG CPLEX Optimization Studio V12.3.

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the version of the OPL library.

        public IloOplModelSource createOplModelSourceFromString(java.lang.String modelText,
                                               java.lang.String modelName)
        Creates an OPL model source from a model given as a string.
        Parameters:
        modelText - The text of the model to be used as a source. It can't be a compiled model (which is a binary file).
        modelName - The name of the model

      • createOplModelSourceFromStream

                                               java.lang.String modelName)
        Creates an OPL model source from a model given as a stream.
        Parameters:
        modelStream - The stream of the model to be used as a source. It may be a compiled model.
        modelName - The name of the model

      • end

        public void end()
        Deletes the OPL environment, clearing all the memory used by the objects created through this factory.
        Notice that you cannot call any method on any OPL object (including this one) after this call.
